params.arbitrator: Address of an arbitrator (zero is returned if no arbitrator was defined)
params.blockTime: timestamp of the block in which the transaction was included
params.escrow: Details of the escrow as stored in the contract

params.blockTime: Timestamp of the block in which the transaction was included

params.amounts: Amounts in token allocated to each party (incl. fees). See UnicrowTypes for mapping of each party (WHO_*)
params.blockTime: Timestamp of the block in which the transaction was included
params.escrowId: ID of the released escrow payment

challenge(uint256,uint16[4],int16[2],uin.details: can be called by UnicrowDispute only

params.challengeEnd: When the new challenge period ends
params.challengeStart: When the new challenge period starts
params.escrowId: ID of the challenged escrow payment
ID of the escrow to be returned
ID of the escrow to be returned

pay((address,address,uint16,address,uint.details: Escrow ID is generated automatically by the contract

params.arbitrator: Arbitrator address (submit zero address to not set an arbitrator)
params.input: Escrow input (seller, marketplace, currency, and challenge period information)

refund(uint256).details: Can be called only by the Seller

params.escrowId: ID of the escrow to be refunded

release(uint256).details: Can be called by the Buyer only

params.escrowId: ID of the escrow to be released

sendEscrowShare(address,uint256,address).details: Transfer ether or token from this contract's treasury. Can be called only by Unicrow's Claim contract

setClaimed(uint256).details: Callable only by other Unicrow contracts

params.escrowId: ID of the escrow to set as claimed

settle(uint256,uint16[4],int16[2]).details: Can be called only by UnicrowDispute

params.escrowId: ID of the escrow to be settled
params.split: New split in bips (total must equal 10000)

splitCalculation(uint16[5]).details: The currentSplit is not expected to equal 100% in total. Buyer and seller splits should equal 100 based on how the payment is settled, other splits represent fees which will get reduced and deducted accordingly

Pay(uint256,uint256,(address,uint64,addr.notice: Emitted when the payment is deposited into the contract and an escrow record is created

Refund(uint256,(address,uint64,address,u.notice: Emitted when seller fully refunds the payment. Detailed calculated values are not returned because the payment is refunded in full, all fees are waived

Release(uint256,uint256,(address,uint64,.notice: Emitted when the buyer releases the payment manually (regardless of the challenge period)

challenge(uint256,uint16[4],int16[2],uin.notice: Function called by UnicrowDispute to execute a challenge

constructor.notice: The contructor initiates immutable and governed references to other contracts

escrowIdCounter().notice: Generates unique escrow ID in incremental order

getAllEscrowData(uint256).notice: Return all the escrow data (incl. arbitration information, settlement offers, and token details)

getEscrow(uint256).notice: Return basic escrow information (excl. arbitration information, settlement offers, and token details)

governanceAddress().notice: address of a governance contract (multisig initially, DAO governor eventually)

pay((address,address,uint16,address,uint.notice: Deposit ETH or SafeERC20 to open a new escrow payment.We don't white- or black-list, but we strongly discourage users from using ERC777 tokensand any ERC20 tokens which perform extra logic in their transfer functions. If the balance claiming transaction fails due to the token's contract error or malicious behavior, it is not possible to try to claim the balance again.

protocolFee().notice: Escrow fee in bips (can never be higher than 100)

refund(uint256).notice: Refund 100% of the buyer payment (all fees are waived).

release(uint256).notice: Release the payment to the seller and to all other parties that charge a fee from it.

setClaimed(uint256).notice: Set the escrow as claimed (i.e. that its balance has been sent to all the parties involved).

settle(uint256,uint16[4],int16[2]).notice: Settle a payment (i.e. split it with arbitrary shares between the buyer and the seller). Fees are reduced proportionally to the seller's share.

splitCalculation(uint16[5]).notice: Calculating the final splits (incl. fees) based on how the payment is concluded.

unicrowArbitrator().notice: Arbitrator information and functionality for the escrows

unicrowClaim().notice: Withdraws payments from the escrows once the criteria are met

unicrowDispute().notice: Dispute resolution, incl. challenges and settlements

updateEscrowFee(uint16).notice: Update protocol fee (governance only, cannot be more than 1%)

userdoc.notice: Receives and distributes the payments, maintains and provides information about the escrow records, and allows basic operations
